snippet: President Obama had opposed provisions of a $662 billion spending measure that would have forced him to try terrorism suspects in military courts and impose strict oil sanctions on Iran.
abstract: President Obama signs modified bill authorizing $662 billion in military spending through 2012, after rejecting provisions that would have forced him to try terrorism suspects in military courts and impose strict sanctions on Iran's oil exports.
lead_paragraph: President Obama had opposed provisions of a $662 billion spending measure that would have forced him to try terrorism suspects in military courts and impose strict oil sanctions on Iran.

headline.main: After Struggle on Detainees, Obama Signs Defense Bill

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
